enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down then normal users are precluded from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: The operational states of a resource.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enum.name: PortDirection
enum.description: The direction of the synchronization interface.

enumMember.name: INPUT_ONLY
enumMember.description:
The port can only input signals.
It cannot output any signals.

enumMember.name: OUTPUT_ONLY
enumMember.description:
The port can only output signals.
It cannot input any signals.

enumMember.name: NO_FAULT
enumMember.description: No faults detected.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_SIGNAL
enumMember.description: No signals received.

enumMember.name: HW_FAULT
enumMember.description: Hardware fault reported from the reference.

enumMember.name: NO_MESSAGES
enumMember.description: No messages received.

enumMember.name: PROTOCOL_NOT_RECOGNIZED
enumMember.description: The protocol used by the reference is not recognized.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_1PPS_SIGNAL
enumMember.description: 1PPS synchronization signal lost.

enumMember.name: NO_SYNC_TO_SATELLITES
enumMember.description: GNSS receiver not synchronized to satellites.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The stability of the 1PPS is considered degraded.

class.name: TimeSyncIO
class.description: The TimeSyncIO is used to indicate that a physical synchronization port is used for time synchronization.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='every $timeSyncIOId in @timeSyncIOId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies ((count(../FrequencySyncIO[($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) + count(../TimeSyncIO[($timeSyncIOId ne @timeSyncIOId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)])) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more FrequencySyncIO/TimeSyncIO cannot refer to the same SyncPort in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='contains(@encapsulation, "SyncPort=")'><value-of select="."/> Attribute encapsulation of a TimeSyncIO can only refer to a SyncPort </assert> <assert test='(@adminPortDirection eq 1)'><value-of select="."/> Attribute adminPortDirection of a TimeSyncIO can only support INPUT_ONLY. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='every $timeSyncIOId in @timeSyncIOId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies ((count(../FrequencySyncIO[($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) + count(../TimeSyncIO[($timeSyncIOId ne @timeSyncIOId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)])) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more FrequencySyncIO/TimeSyncIO cannot refer to the same SyncPort in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='contains(@encapsulation, "SyncPort=")'><value-of select="."/> Attribute encapsulation of a TimeSyncIO can only refer to a SyncPort </assert> <assert test='(@adminPortDirection eq 1)'><value-of select="."/> Attribute adminPortDirection of a TimeSyncIO can only support INPUT_ONLY. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: adminPortDirection
attribute.description: Specifies the direction of the time synchronization I/O port
attribute.dependencies: Attribute adminPortDirection of a TimeSyncIO can only support INPUT_ONLY.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: compensationDelay
attribute.description:
The delay of the input signal.
The delay is calculated using the documentation of the GPS receiver System for RBS 6000.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description:
Reference to the underlying encapsulation.
The underlying encapsulation must be a SyncPort MO.
attribute.dependencies: Two or more FrequencySyncIO/TimeSyncIO cannot refer to the same SyncPort in attribute encapsulation. Attribute encapsulation of a TimeSyncIO can only refer to a SyncPort.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: timeSyncIOId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: timeSyncIOStatus
attribute.description: Status of TimeSyncIO MO as reference.
